alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 5:40AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following counties, Douglas, Franklin, Osage, Shawnee and Wabaunsee. * WHEN...Until 845 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Topeka, Ottawa, Baldwin City, Carbondale, Richland, Wellsville, Dover, Auburn, Overbrook, Centropolis, Burlingame, Scranton, Globe and Keene.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
